Medical Laboratory Scientist Job at the Lamb Medical Center




        
    

        
        The Lamb Medical Center is a newly established healthcare facility located in the heart of Mowe, committed to delivering quality, accessible, and compassionate medical services to the community. Founded with a vision to improve community health and well-being, The Lamb Medical Center offers a range of primary and preventive healthcare services aimed at meeting the needs of individuals and families in the area. Our focus is on patient-centered care, professionalism, and health education. We are equipped with modern facilities and staffed by dedicated professionals who are passionate about making a positive impact in the lives of our patients.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Medical Laboratory Scientist
     

            
    



Job Location: Mowe, Ogun

Responsibilities


	Good knowledge of laboratory equipment
	Collect blood or tissue samples from patients, observing principles of asepsis to obtain blood samples.
	Maintaining and updating professional knowledge and taking responsibility for continuing professional development (CPD).
	Perform all tasks, duties, and tests related to laboratory services
	Process specimens utilizing protocols and technical knowledge
	Perform quality control, preventive maintenance, troubleshooting protocols to ensure proper functioning of instruments, reagents, procedures, etc
	Validate and report the results of tests performed
	Able to meet Turnaround time and in conformance with applicable confidentiality requirements
	Knowledge of Good Laboratory Practice.
	Attend all trainings as required by the hospital, relevant national policies and Laboratory Practice license requirements
	Research and develop new procedures required.


Requirements & Skills


	Candidates should possess a Bachelor’s Degree in any relevant field with at least 4 years of post-NYSC working experience
	Born-again Christian, and possess godly Christian core values
	Must have post-NYSC working experience.
	Must be registered with a practicing license.
	Knowledge in the handling of laboratory equipment.
	Computer literate.
	Knowledge in the use of Standard Operating Procedures in the field.
	BMLS /AMLSCN certificate will be an added advantage
	Candidates should be living within Moweaxis.


Minimum Qualification / Requirements:


	Aptitude for biology and chemistry.
	Patience, decisiveness and meticulousness.
	A desire to contribute to patient care and treatment.
	A responsible and mature approach to their work.
	Excellent computer skills.
	Accuracy, with good attention to detail.
	A systematic approach to tasks and the ability to follow instructions and set procedures.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and license copy to: kingdom.lamb2023@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Farm Supervisor Job at Edgewood Consulting Limited




        
    

        
        Edgewood Consulting Limited - Our client, a thriving Agro Allied Company located in Ogun State, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Farm Supervisor

Job Location: Ijebu, Ode Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Farm Supervisor oversees daily farm operations, ensuring crops are efficiently managed to meet production targets.
	This role involves planning, coordinating, supervising farm workers, and implementing best agricultural practices to maximize productivity, quality, and profitability.


Key Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Plan and schedule daily farming activities, including planting, irrigation, fertilization and harvesting.
	Supervise and coordinate farm workers, assigning tasks and ensuring adherence to safety and operational standards.
	Monitor crop growth and soil conditions to optimize yield and quality.
	Operate and maintain farm equipment, ensuring timely servicing and repairs.
	Implement pest and disease control measures and ensure compliance with environmental regulations.
	Maintain accurate farm records, including production, expenses, labor, and inventory.
	Assist in budget preparation and cost-control measures to improve farm profitability.
	Ensure proper storage, packaging, and transportation of farm produce.
	Train and mentor farm staff to improve skills and productivity.
	Liaise with farm owners, suppliers, and agricultural experts to source quality inputs and adopt modern farming techniques.


Qualifications and Skills


	Candidates should possess a Diploma or Degree in Agriculture, Agricultural Science, or a related field (preferred).
	Minimum of 2–4 years’ experience in farm management or supervisory role.
	Must know how to farm (Practical, not theoretical) with proven evidence
	Must love Farming. We need someone that is hands-on
	Strong knowledge of crop production techniques.
	Ability to operate farm machinery and equipment.
	Leadership and people management skills.
	Trustworthy, Honest, Hardworking and Loyal
	Good record-keeping, planning, and organizational skills.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: edgewoodconsultingofficial@gmail.com using "Farm Supervisor " as the subject of the mail.

Note: Only qualified Candidates will be contacted.

  "description": "SOLEVO Group&nbsp;is a leading distributor of chemicals and inputs for specific industrial and agricultural segments in Africa. SOLEVO assists African farmers and Industries succeed by providing them with a full range of fertilisers, seeds, crop protection products and industrial chemicals they need with a guaranteed quality and good value.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Research &amp; Development Manager - Printing Ink
